messages.title: A PERSONAL MESSAGE FROM DAVID CAMERON
messages.content: The choice at this election is clear: five more years of Gordon Brown's tired government making things worse or change with the Conservatives.

messages.title: 60 SECOND Q&A WITH KEMI ADEGOKE
messages.content: Kemi answers questions on the economy, education, public transport, and antisocial behaviour.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Reduce waste, fix the country's credit card and not raise taxes.
Give parents power to set up new schools and head teachers control over expulsions.
Work hard for better public transport investment in the area.
Push for elected police chiefs and let locals decide what the police do.

issues.economy: Reduce waste and the country's credit card debt without raising taxes.
issues.education: Support for school governance to fully support new schools and give head teachers control over expulsions.

contactInformation.address: Conservative Campaign Headquarters, 30 Millbank, London SW1P 4DP

images.caption: David Cameron with a note, Kemi Adegoke taking action in the community, greening up the cities, campaigning for more primary school places, and keeping libraries open.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Kemi's factfile: 30 years old and lives in Herne Hill in the heart of the constituency, Worked at McDonald's for 7 years, Firm job was at Lidl, Has two degrees, one in Computer Systems Engineering and the other in Law. A keen chess and poker player.
